result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter B. ROBLEY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution to Norbert Braun, 6501 CTH J, Cato, WI 54230.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Successfully complete a driver safety course.  

Apology to the victim's family if agent believes more needs to be done.

timeConds.notes: under the Huber Law.   Court will authorize release for attendance at the town board meeting.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter B. ROBLEY

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was terminated from probation effective 10-07-15.

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction.
Restitution amount is set at -0-.  The defendant paid the victim directly.
Cover letter.
Judgment of Conviction Sentence Withheld, Probation Ordered.  Duplicate original delivered to DOC and Sheriff.
Proposed resolution letter from ADA Vendetti.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 09-18-14 at 3:00 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 08-13-14 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours.  Bail furnished.  
Minutes.

RE:  Clara Braun, on 01-23-14.
Initial appearance is set for 08-04-14 at 9:30 a.m.
